"Karin":
"This will explain about item drops.

The enemies that appear in Extreme Stages are artificially replicated.

Because of that, the item drops are very hard to replicate, and they are unstable when they appear.

Those kinds of items appear with a special icon."

column3:
"Items that drop with this special icon do not go into your Inventory when picked up. Since their data is unstable, they are stored as Virtual Items in a special space.

Virtual Items stored in the special space will disappear when you return to the Campship. Only when you complete a Quest, can you take a fixed number of them back with you from the Extreme Terminal."

"Karin":
"This will explain about Stage Orders.

During Extreme Quests, we will give you experimental orders during each stage, known as a 'Stage Order'.

By fulfilling these orders, you will increase the number of items enemies drop when you defeat them.

Also, every time you fulfill a certain amount of orders, the amount of items you can take back with you when you complete the Quest will increase."

"There are certain Stage Orders that require the player to not use any recovery effects in order to complete them.

*However, recovery effects from your Mag, ones that automatically activate from a skill, or ones from Cash Shop Items are exceptions to this rule."

"This will explain 'Hostile Ability Changes'.

In Extreme Quests, we have artificially strengthened the enemies in order to create a harsh environment for the Quest. This strengthening is called 'Hostile Ability Changes'.

However, a Hostile Ability Change that would strengthen a hostile's resistances can be inverted by completing a 'Stage Order' in the previous stage, turning it into an advantage for the player."

will also increase the numbers of items you get to
keep at the end of the simulation!"
